net.sf.mmm.util.version.impl

Class VersionIdentifierFormatterVersionSegments

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.base.AbstractFormatter<VersionIdentifier>
      • net.sf.mmm.util.version.impl.VersionIdentifierFormatterVersionSegments
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Formatter<VersionIdentifier>

    public class VersionIdentifierFormatterVersionSegments
extends AbstractFormatter<VersionIdentifier>
    This is the implementation of Formatter for the plain version number.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Constructor Detail

      • VersionIdentifierFormatterVersionSegments

        public VersionIdentifierFormatterVersionSegments(StringUtil stringUtil,
                                                 String prefix,
                                                 String segmentSeparator,
                                                 int minimumSegmentCount,
                                                 int maximumSegmentCount,
                                                 int segmentPadding)
        The constructor.
        Parameters:
        stringUtil - is the StringUtil instance.
        prefix - is the static prefix to append before the number. Will be omitted if the number is null.
        segmentSeparator - is the separator for segments. The typical value is the dot sign (".").
        minimumSegmentCount - is the minimum number of segments to format. The default is 0.
        maximumSegmentCount - is maximum number of segments to format. The default is Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        segmentPadding - is the padding (minimum number of digits) for each segment. The default is 0.

    • Method Detail

      • doFormat

        protected void doFormat(VersionIdentifier value,
                        Appendable buffer)
                 throws IOException
        Specified by:
        doFormat in class AbstractFormatter<VersionIdentifier>
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to format (not null).
        buffer - is the Appendable to append the formatted value to.
        Throws:
        IOException - if caused by append.
        See Also:
        AbstractFormatter.format(Object, Appendable)

      • doFormatSegment

        protected CharSequence doFormatSegment(VersionIdentifier value,
                                       int index)
        This method formats the segment at the given index.
        Parameters:
        value - is the VersionIdentifier.
        index - is the index of the segment to format.
        Returns:
        the formatted segment.
